info.title: BitMEX API
info.description:
REST API for the BitMEX.com trading platform.

REST Documentation
Websocket Documentation

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: If true, will sort results newest first.

get.description: Returns an array with browser users in the first position and API users (bots) in the second position.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: Array of column names to fetch. If omitted, will return all columns.

post.description: API Keys can also be created via this Python script. See the API Key Documentation for more information on capabilities.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Key name. This name is for reference only.

parameters.name: cidr
parameters.description: CIDR block to restrict this key to. To restrict to a single address, append "/32", e.g. 207.39.29.22/32. Leave blank or set to 0.0.0.0/0 to allow all IPs. Only one block may be set. More on CIDR blocks

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: Key Permissions. All keys can read margin and position data. Additional permissions must be added. Available: ["order", "withdraw"].

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Set to true to enable this key on creation. Otherwise, it must be explicitly enabled via /apiKey/enable.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: If true, will sort results newest first.

get.summary: Get all raw executions for your account.
get.description: This returns all raw transactions, which includes order opening and cancelation, and order status changes. It can be quite noisy. More focused information is available at /execution/tradeHistory. You may also use the `filter` param to target your query. Specify an array as a filter value, such as {"execType": ["Settlement", "Trade"]} to filter on multiple values.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description:
Instrument symbol. Send a bare series (e.g. XBU) to get data for the nearest expiring contract in that series.

You can also send a timeframe, e.g. 'XBU:monthly'. Timeframes are 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'quarterly', and 'biquarterly'.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Generic table filter. Send JSON key/value pairs, such as {"key": "value"}. You can key on individual fields, and do more advanced querying on timestamps. See http://localhost:2001/app/restAPI#timestamp-filters for more details.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description:
Array of column names to fetch. If omitted, will return all columns.

Note that this method will always return item keys, even when not specified, so you may receive more columns that you expect.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: If true, will sort results newest first.

get.summary: Get all balance-affecting executions. This includes each trade, insurance charge, and settlement.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description:

You can also send a timeframe, e.g. 'XBU:monthly'. Timeframes are 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'quarterly', and 'biquarterly'.

get.description: This returns all instruments and indices, including those that have settled or are unlisted. Use this endpoint if you want to query for individual instruments or use a complex filter. Use the endpoint /instrument/active to return active instruments, or use a filter like {"state": "Open"}.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description:
Instrument symbol. Send a bare series (e.g. XBU) to get data for the nearest expiring contract in that series.

You can also send a timeframe, e.g. 'XBU:monthly'. Timeframes are 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'quarterly', and 'biquarterly'.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Generic table filter. Send JSON key/value pairs, such as {"key": "value"}. You can key on individual fields, and do more advanced querying on timestamps. See http://localhost:2001/app/restAPI#timestamp-filters for more details.

get.summary: Get all active instruments and instruments that have expired in <24hrs.
Helper method. Gets all active instruments and all indices. This is a join of the result of /indices and /active.
Return all active contract series and interval pairs.
get.description: This endpoint is useful for determining which pairs are live. It returns two arrays of   strings. The first is intervals, such as `["BVOL:daily", "BVOL:weekly", "XBU:daily", "XBU:monthly", ...]`. These identifiers are usable in any query's "symbol" param. The second array is the current resolution of these intervals. Results are mapped at the same index.
To get open orders only, send {"open": true} in the filter param.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description:
Instrument symbol. Send a bare series (e.g. XBU) to get data for the nearest expiring contract in that series.

You can also send a timeframe, e.g. 'XBU:monthly'. Timeframes are 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'quarterly', and 'biquarterly'.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Generic table filter. Send JSON key/value pairs, such as {"key": "value"}. You can key on individual fields, and do more advanced querying on timestamps. See http://localhost:2001/app/restAPI#timestamp-filters for more details.

parameters.name: columns

Array of column names to fetch. If omitted, will return all columns.

Note that this method will always return item keys, even when not specified, so you may receive more columns that you expect.

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: If true, will sort results newest first.

post.description: This endpoint is used for placing orders. Valid order types are 'Limit' and 'StopLimit'. If none is provided, BitMEX will assume a Limit Order. A note on API tools: if you want to keep track of order IDs yourself, set a unique clOrdID per order. This ID will come back as a property on the order and any related executions (including on the WebSocket), and can be used to get or cancel the order. Max length is 36 characters. To generate a clOrdID, consider setting a prefix, and incrementing a counter or generating a UUID. Some UUIDs are longer than 36 characters, so use a url-safe base64 encoding. For example, the prefix 'bmex_mm_' and the UUID '7fbd6545-bb0c-11e4-a273-6003088a7c04' creates 'bmex_mm_f71lRbsMEeSic2ADCIp8BA'. See the BitMEX Reference Market Maker for an example of how to use and generate clOrdIDs.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: Quantity. Use positive numbers to buy, negative to sell.

parameters.name: stopPrice
parameters.description: If order type is 'StopLimit', this is the trigger/stop price.

parameters.name: clOrdID
parameters.description: Optional Client Order ID to give this order. This ID will come back on any execution messages tied to this order.

delete.summary: Cancel order(s). Send multiple order IDs to cancel in bulk.
delete.description: Either an orderID or a clOrdID must be provided.

post.summary: Close a position with a market order.
post.description: If no price is specified, a market order will be submitted to close the entirety of your position. Be careful with market orders as you may not be filled at a favorable price.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Optional symbol. If provided, only cancels orders for that symbol.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional filter for cancellation. Use to only cancel some orders, e.g. `{"side": "Buy"}`.

post.summary: Automatically cancel all your orders after a specified timeout.
post.description:
Useful as a dead-man's switch to ensure your orders are canceled in case of an outage. If called repeatedly, the existing offset will be canceled and a new one will be inserted in its place.

Example usage: call this route at 15s intervals with an offset of 60000 (60s). If this route is not called within 60 seconds, all your orders will be automatically canceled.

This is also available via WebSocket.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Timeout in ms. Set to 0 to cancel this timer.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Instrument symbol. Send a series (e.g. XBT) to get data for the nearest contract in that series.

parameters.name: columns
parameters.description: Which columns to fetch. For example, send ["columnName"].

post.description: On Speculative (DPE-Enabled) contracts, users can switch isolate margin per-position. This function allows switching margin isolation (aka fixed margin) on and off. A position must be open to isolate it.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: If true, will enable isolated margin.

post.summary: Transfer equity in or out of a position.
post.description: When margin is isolated on a position, use this function to add or remove margin from the position. Note that you cannot remove margin below the initial margin threshold.

parameters.name: amount
parameters.description: Amount to transfer, in satoshis. May be negative.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description:

You can also send a timeframe, e.g. 'XBU:monthly'. Timeframes are 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'quarterly', and 'biquarterly'.

get.summary: Get trades between two dates. [Deprecated, use GET /trades]

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Instrument symbol. Send a series (e.g. XBT) to get data for the nearest contract in that series.

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: Instrument symbol. Send a series (e.g. XBT) to get data for the nearest contract in that series.

get.summary: Get a history of all of your wallet transactions (deposits and withdrawals).

post.summary: Request a withdrawal to an external wallet.
post.description: This will send a confirmation email to the email address on record, unless requested via an API Key with the "withdraw" permission.

parameters.name: otpToken
parameters.description: 2FA token. Required if 2FA is enabled on your account.

parameters.name: fee
parameters.description: Network fee for Bitcoin withdrawals. If not specified, a default value will be calculated based on Bitcoin network conditions. You will have a chance to confirm this via email.

post.summary: Get Google Authenticator secret key for setting up two-factor auth. Fails if already enabled. Use /confirmEnableTFA for Yubikeys.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Two-factor auth type. Supported types: 'GA' (Google Authenticator)

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: If Yubikey, send one output from the key.

post.summary: Confirm two-factor auth for this account. If using a Yubikey, simply send a token to this endpoint.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Two-factor auth type. Supported types: 'GA' (Google Authenticator), 'Yubikey'

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Token from your selected TFA type.

post.summary: Disable two-factor auth for this account.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Two-factor auth type. Supported types: 'GA' (Google Authenticator)

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Token from your selected TFA type.

post.summary: Confirm your email address with a token.

get.summary: Check if a referral code is valid.
get.description: If the code is valid, responds with the referral code's discount (e.g. `0.1` for 10%). Otherwise, will return a 404.

parameters.name: acceptsTOS
parameters.description: Set to true to indicate acceptance of the Terms of Service (https://www.bitmex.com/app/terms).

put.summary: Update your password, name, and other attributes.

parameters.name: pgpPubKey
parameters.description: PGP Public Key. If specified, automated emails will be sentwith this key.

post.summary: Log all systems out of BitMEX. This will revoke all of your account's access tokens, logging you out on all devices.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: If true, will overwrite all existing preferences.

scheme.description: See the API docs for the list of supported values.

ttl.description: time to live in seconds (2 weeks by default)

principalType.description: The principal type, such as user, application, or role
